pr_title: PLANNER-2226 - Prune kogito dep tree + adjust assembly scripts to 11

timeline.message: PLANNER-2226 - Prune kogito dep tree + adjust assembly scripts to 11

timeline.bodyText: What is the reason for increasing the maximal amount of memory?
timeline.author: rsynek
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -3,15 +3,14 @@
 # Change directory to the directory of the script
 cd `dirname $0`
 
-# Most examples run (potentially slower) with max heap of 128 MB (so -Xmx128m), but 1 example's dataset requires 1.5 GB
-jvmOptions="-Xms256m -Xmx1536m -Dorg.optaplanner.examples.dataDir=sources/data/"
+# Most examples run (potentially slower) with max heap of 128 MB (so -Xmx128m), but 1 example's dataset requires 2 GB
+jvmOptions="-Xms256m -Xmx2g -Dorg.optaplanner.examples.dataDir=sources/data/"

replies.bodyText:
In some garbage collectors, 1.5G is not enough for Machine Reassignment, or it's in the "gray zone" (enough but impacts perf badly a lot).
These days, 2g is far less of a concern than it was 10 years ago
replies.author: ge0ffrey

timeline.bodyText: The PR has been already merged.
timeline.author: rsynek
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -27,16 +27,19 @@
       <artifactId>optaplanner-core</artifactId>
       <exclusions>
         <exclusion>
+          <!-- Dynamic is not compatible with GraalVM native compilation -->
           <groupId>org.kie.kogito</groupId>
           <artifactId>drools-core-dynamic</artifactId>
         </exclusion>
       </exclusions>
     </dependency>
     <dependency>
+      <!-- Static replaces dynamic -->
       <groupId>org.kie.kogito</groupId>
       <artifactId>drools-core-static</artifactId>
     </dependency>
     <dependency>
+      <!-- TODO remove kogito-ruleunits with fix https://github.com/kiegroup/kogito-runtimes/pull/871 -->

replies.bodyText: Ah nice, let me try that out.
replies.author: ge0ffrey
